column4: Does GNOME have something like KDE's dcop? So we can control our apps
CTRL-CONTROL-DELETE
hm. I don't think this is what I need. In kde you could just do: dcop amarok default nextSong, and next song would be played. I'm asking if there something like that on GNOME
how did you install gtk?
from the repos
through apt/synaptic?
whatcha trying to install?
yes through synaptic. I'm trying to install php-gtk
is it in the repos?
if it was I would not be here asking this question :P
fair enough
it passes the glib test tho, not the gtk
where did you get it from?
php-gtk? it's cvs
I tried, I'll try again I guess :p
if you want to look at it..
did you install libgtk or libgtk2.0?
yes
libgtk-dev, libgtk, libgtk2.0 and libgtk2.0-dev are installed
I see ...
no clue why it is not happening ...
I read the config.log, it was looking for gtk/gtk.h. I did a ln -s /usr/include/gtk-2.0/gtk /usr/include/gtk, now in config.log I see something about gdk/gdk.h, I'll try to install that one
I dunno what to say ...
as soon as I get it working I'll tell you :p
